summary: Brian S. Latell, identified as the Director of the Center for the Study of Intelligence, is mentioned in CIA documents pertaining to the JFK assassination records review. His involvement centers around the CIA's interactions with the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB) and the House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence (HPSCI) concerning the declassification and release of related materials. Specifically, he advised against appealing the JFK Review Board's decision to release the names of two CIA employees who retired under cover, arguing that the Directorate of Operations' (DO) damage argument would not warrant Presidential reversal. His role appears to be related to the review, sanitization, and potential withholding of information within the CIA's process regarding JFK assassination records.
key_connections: House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence (HPSCI)
significance: Medium - Brian S. Latell's involvement in the JFK assassination records review process, particularly his advisory role regarding declassification decisions, suggests a moderate level of significance. While his specific actions are not detailed, his position within the Center for the Study of Intelligence and his interaction with key review boards indicate his participation in sensitive aspects of the document release.
